definition: to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: In this paper, we analyze the force-fighting mechanism of quad redundant servo system.
sentences.chinese: 对四余度伺服系统的力纷争现象进行了机理分析。

sentences.english: So what are the lessons of the rare earth fracas?
sentences.chinese: 那么这场稀土纷争给人什么的教训？

sentences.english: When wilt thou sort an hour great strifes to end?
sentences.chinese: 你选定什么时辰终止剧烈的纷争？

sentences.english: A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord mong brethren.
sentences.chinese: 吐谎言的假见证，并弟兄中布散纷争的人。

sentences.english: Nothing will contribute more to that than an extended re-litigation of the last eight years.
sentences.chinese: 过去8年，年复一年的漫长纷争只会使之雪上加霜。

sentences.english: While you preach peace, you make it the business of your life to stir up dissension.
sentences.chinese: 你一边宣传和平，一边又干着煽动纷争的营生。

sentences.english: And he promised to transcend those partisan divisions.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺要超越这些党派纷争。

sentences.english: In both languages, the name means "fishing islands, " but these days the rocky, uninhabited islands are better known for discord.
sentences.chinese: 但这些天来，这个无人居住的石头岛以纷争闻名世界。

sentences.english: There are sudden changes and powerful rivalries in Chinese television market.
sentences.chinese: 中国电视市场，群雄纷争，风起云涌。

sentences.english: The shrillness may disguise disagreement in Pyongyang about how to deal with Mr Lee and Mr Obama.
sentences.chinese: 在平壤，关于李明博与奥巴马的纷争尖锐刺耳。

sentences.english: Lack of water may also result in more international conflict.
sentences.chinese: 水缺乏也会引起更多的国际纷争。

sentences.english: Where there was harmony she brought discord.
sentences.chinese: 哪儿有和谐，她就把纷争带到哪里。

sentences.english: Behind the scenes in recent weeks, the skirmishing has grown intense.
sentences.chinese: 近几周来，双方的纷争暗中变得激烈起来。

sentences.english: Mr. Smith has been asked to arbitrate between the employers and their workers.
sentences.chinese: 已经请了史密斯先生来仲裁雇主与工人之间的纷争。

sentences.english: Members of the British royal family rarely enter the political frays .
sentences.chinese: 英国的皇室成员很少卷入政治纷争。

sentences.english: The two seemed to have since settled their differences however.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩似乎以后必定有解不完的纷争。

definition: internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
